fairy_sparklers.name: Fairy Sparklers
fairy_sparklers.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

bottle_rockets.name: Bottle Rockets
bottle_rockets.description: A bottle rocket is a small skyrocket. A typical bottle rocket consists of a rocket engine attached to a stabilizing stick.

roman_candles.name: Roman Candles
roman_candles.description: A Roman candle is a traditional type of firework that ejects one or more stars or exploding shells.

peony.name: Peony
peony.description: When you picture “fireworks” in your head, this is probably the mental image that you conjure up. No tails, no trails, just pure crackly, sparkly, globe-shaped bliss.

girandolas.name: Girandola
girandolas.description: These wheel-like fireworks spin rapidly up into the air, shooting off sprays of sparks and sometimes emitting a high-pitched whistle.

comet.name: Comets
comet.description: These bright spheres shoot upward and leave behind a thick glittery trail. They usually look best spread out in a row, as a prelude to a larger effect.

hummer.name: Hummers
hummer.description: these firewords make a humming noise.

whistler.name: Whistlers
whistler.description: These fireworks make a whistling noise.

crackler.name: Cracklers
crackler.description: These fireworks make a distinctive crackling noise.

ammonium_nitrate.name: Ammonium Nitrate
ammonium_nitrate.description: Ammonium nitrate is a chemical compound, the nitrate salt of the ammonium cation.

nitrogen_trichloride.name: Nitrogen Trichloride
nitrogen_trichloride.description: Nitrogen trichloride, also known as trichloramine, is the chemical compound with the formula NCl3. This yellow, oily, pungent-smelling liquid is most commonly encountered as a byproduct of chemical reactions between ammonia-derivatives and chlorine.

tetryl.name: Tetryl
tetryl.description: 2,4,6-Trinitrophenylmethylnitramine commonly referred to as tetryl (C7H5N5O8) is an explosive compound used to make detonators and explosive booster charges.

plutonium.name: Plutonium
plutonium.description: Plutonium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element with symbol Pu and atomic number 94.

Hydrogen.name: hydrogen
Hydrogen.description: Hydrogen is a chemical element with symbol H and atomic number 1. With a standard atomic weight of circa 1.008, hydrogen is the lightest element on the periodic table.

Uranium.name: uranium
Uranium.description: Uranium is a chemical element with symbol U and atomic number 92. It is a silvery-white metal in the actinide series of the periodic table.

anfo.name: ANFO
anfo.description: ANFO (or AN/FO, for ammonium nitrate/fuel oil) is a widely used bulk industrial explosive.

TNT.name: TNT
TNT.description: TNT is a chemical compound with the formula C6H2(NO2)3CH3. This yellow solid is sometimes used as a reagent in chemical synthesis, but it is best known as an explosive material with convenient handling properties.

PETN.name: PETN
PETN.description: PETN is one of the most powerful explosive materials known, with a relative effectiveness factor of 1.66. When mixed with a plasticizer, PETN forms a plastic explosive.
